poem:
Title: Of Spirits and Sacrifices

In the weft of tequila nights undulating,
Twines your tale, Rochelle, vivifying, captivating.
Two-fold love's luminescence burning,
In single mother's sacrifice, ever churning.
Absences too, inseparable from presences,
Part of life's allegorical dalliances.
Joy stretches not in a world ideal, but real -
In the salt-rimmed moments, spontaneous zeal.
